He is determined that he will be master. When in heaven he said, "What need have the angels of any law?" "Why hast thou fallen from heaven, O Lucifer?" Because he wanted to be equal with Christ, and when he fell he brought many of the angels with him. They took his side. The enemy is 


                                      -233- 

working just as sharply and decidedly now as he worked upon the minds of Adam and Eve in Eden. The people are gathering under his banner, and he is encircling them with his power. But everyone that sees that the law of God is changeless in its character will decide on the side of Christ. If God could have changed one precept of His law to meet fallen man, then Jesus Christ need never have come to our earth to die.
